thread.title: Former Agrimark employee to admit stealing $1M
thread.title_full: Former Agrimark employee to admit stealing $1M - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: WCAX News
title: Former Agrimark employee to admit stealing $1M
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. - The former head of technology for the dairy co-op Agrimark is preparing to plead guilty to stealing $1 million from the company.
Agrimark is the parent company of the Cabot Creamery, the award-winning cheesemaker.
Federal prosecutors say while building out Cabot's corporate offices in Waitsfield, Ronald Rup, 53, purchased and sold unnecessary gear and kept the profits.
According to court documents, Rup has agreed to plead guilty to wire fraud. Under the deal, Rup has agreed to pay back the stolen money and could be sentenced to up to 20 years in prison, though prosecutors will recommend a lighter sentence.
